summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.name: T:Amazon.BackupSearch.Internal.AmazonBackupSearchEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon BackupSearch endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for BackupSearch service requests. Collects values for BackupSearchEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses BackupSearchEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.EBSItemFilter.CreationTimes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTimes.
You can include 1 to 10 values.
If one is included, the results will return only items that match.
If more than one is included, the results will return all items that match any of the included values.

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilePaths.
You can include 1 to 10 values.
If one file path is included, the results will return only items that match the file path.
If more than one file path is included, the results will return all items that match any of the file paths.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.CompletionTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CompletionTime.
The date and time that a search job completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
The date and time that a search job was created, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CompletionTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.CurrentSearchProgress
member.summary:

The encryption key for the specified search job.
Example: arn:aws:kms:us-west-2:111122223333:key/1234abcd-12ab-34cd-56ef-1234567890ab.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.ItemFilters

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.SearchJobArn
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.SearchJobIdentifier
member.summary:

The unique string that identifies the specified search job.

member.summary:

The search scope is all backup properties input into a search.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.SearchScopeSummary
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SearchScopeSummary.
Returned summary of the specified search job scope, including:
TotalBackupsToScanCount, the number of recovery points returned by the search.
TotalItemsToScanCount, the number of items returned by the search.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The current status of the specified search job.
A search job may have one of the following statuses: RUNNING; COMPLETED; STOPPED; FAILED; TIMED_OUT; or EXPIRED .

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchJobResponse.StatusMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusMessage.
A status message will be returned for either a earch job with a status of ERRORED or a status of COMPLETED jobs with issues.
For example, a message may say that a search contained recovery points unable to be scanned because of a permissions issue.

member.name: T:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchResultExportJobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GetSearchResultExportJob operation. This operation retrieves the metadata of an export job.
An export job is an operation that transmits the results of a search job to a specified S3 bucket in a .csv file.
An export job allows you to retain results of a search beyond the search job's scheduled retention of 7 days.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.GetSearchResultExportJobRequest.ExportJobIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ExportJobIdentifier.
This is the unique string that identifies a specific export job.
Required for this operation.

member.summary:

The date and time that an export job completed, in Unix format and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). The value of CreationTime is accurate to milliseconds. For example, the value 1516925490.087 represents Friday, January 26, 2018 12:11:30.087 AM.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.ListSearchJobBackupsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListSearchJobBackups operation. This operation returns a list of all backups (recovery points) in a paginated format that were included in the search job.
If a search does not display an expected backup in the results, you can call this operation to display each backup included in the search. Any backups that were not included because they have a FAILED status from a permissions issue will be displayed, along with a status message.
Only recovery points with a backup index that has a status of ACTIVE will be included in search results. If the index has any other status, its status will be displayed along with a status message.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.ListSearchJobBackupsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of resource list items to be returned.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.ListSearchJobBackupsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The next item following a partial list of returned backups included in a search job.
For example, if a request is made to return MaxResults number of backups, NextToken allows you to return more items in your list starting at the location pointed to by the next token.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.ListSearchJobBackupsRequest.SearchJobIdentifier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SearchJobIdentifier.
The unique string that specifies the search job.

member.name: T:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.StartSearchJobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StartSearchJob operation. This operation creates a search job which returns recovery points filtered by SearchScope and items filtered by ItemFilters.
You can optionally include ClientToken, EncryptionKeyArn, Name, and/or Tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.StartSearchJobRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
Include this parameter to allow multiple identical calls for idempotency.
A client token is valid for 8 hours after the first request that uses it is completed. After this time, any request with the same token is treated as a new request.

member.name: P:Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.StartSearchJobRequest.EncryptionKeyArn
member.summary:

member.summary:

Include alphanumeric characters to create a name for this search job.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.BackupSearch.AmazonBackupSearchClient

Implementation for accessing BackupSearch
Backup Search
Backup Search is the recovery point and item level search for Backup.

Backup API Reference
Backup Developer Guide

member.name: M:Amazon.BackupSearch.AmazonBackupSearchClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonBackupSearchClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.summary:

An export job is an operation that transmits the results of a search job to a specified S3 bucket in a .csv file.
An export job allows you to retain results of a search beyond the search job's scheduled retention of 7 days.

member.name: M:Amazon.BackupSearch.AmazonBackupSearchClient.ListSearchJobBackupsAsync(Amazon.BackupSearch.Model.ListSearchJobBackupsRequest,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
This operation returns a list of all backups (recovery points) in a paginated format that were included in the search job.
If a search does not display an expected backup in the results, you can call this operation to display each backup included in the search. Any backups that were not included because they have a FAILED status from a permissions issue will be displayed, along with a status message.
Only recovery points with a backup index that has a status of ACTIVE will be included in search results. If the index has any other status, its status will be displayed along with a status message.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ListSearchJobBackups service method.
A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the ListSearchJobBackups service method, as returned by BackupSearch.
member.exception: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.
